title: Leicester Mercury published Businesses hope to win Italian titles
text:
Businesses hope to win Italian titles By Leicester Mercury | Posted: August 01, 2016 0 COMMENTS SHARES Sapori, Anstey, nominated for best restaurant award Businesses hope to win Italian titles X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Two Leicestershire businesses have been nominated for prizes at the English Italian Awards 2016. 
Sapori, of Anstey, has been nominated for the Best Restaurant (over 50 seats) award, while Ventola Projects, of Anstey, has been nominated for the Best Italian Business award. 
Luigi Riccardi, who co-manages Sapori with his sister Christina and her husband Andrea Scarpati, said: "We make every item on the menu from scratch in our kitchen, from the bread sticks to the gelato and all the desserts. 
"This is why, in November 2015, we were awarded best Italian Restaurant in England. 
"We make sure that we go that extra mile to wow our guests." 
Mick Ventola, managing director of lighting installation business Ventola Projects, said: "Being based in Leicestershire gives us the perfect opportunity to trade both in Europe, the US and the Middle East and we have no plans to move our business as a result of the recent Brexit vote."
